info.name: Internal arcuate fibers
info.description: Internal arcuate fibers is a term that refers to nerve fibers that arc across the medulla. Most often this refers to those second-order somatosensory nerve fibers that originate in the cuneate and gracile nuclei and then decussate to form the medial lemniscus. However, this term is also used for the olivocerebellar fibers that originate in the inferior olivary nucleus, cross the midline and enter the contralateral inferior cerebellar peduncle.
